Package players

Class Battleship

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
players.Battleship
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class Battleship extends javafx.application.Application implements Observer
This class is the main view class of the entire Battleship game. To start the game, two instances of this view class needs to be created, the server(player 1) or the client(player 2). The type of instance created is based on what command line arguments are inputed. Each instances will create their own GUI application that interacts with the users. Once the GUIS are displayed, the game is ready to play. Here is how the game works: 1. Each player must place all of their ships anywhere on their own grid before making a move. 2. Player 1 gets to go first and makes a move. 3. Player 2 takes the move and determines the result. 4. Player 2 notifies Player 1 of the result. 5. PLayer 2 gets to go next and Vice Versa until one of the player's fleet is complete destroyed. Here is the command line argument structure when starting the program: (server or client) (port number). ** Note ** You need two process to play the game, so you must run the program twice. ** Note ** You must create the server(player 1) process first or else the game wouldn't start.
Author:
Luke Genova, Amimul Ehsan Zoha

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This is the main class that will run the program.
      Parameters:
      args - This array of strings represents the command line arguments.

    • makeServer

      private void makeServer(int portNumber)
      This private method creates the server(player 1) of the game and waits for the client to establish a connection. Once connected, the game will start between the server and the client. This method also creates the instance's own thread which takes in output from the other player.
      Parameters:
      portNumber - An integer that represents the port number of the connection.

    • makeClient

      private void makeClient(int portNumber)
      This private method creates the client(player 2) of the game which is needed to start the game. Once connected, the game will start between the server and the client. This method also creates the instance's own thread which takes in output from the other player.
      Parameters:
      portNumber - An integer that represents the port number of the connection.

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      This method is called when the Observed object has changed and notifies the observer. This method also notifies the other player thats connected when there is a change to itself.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - the observable object.
      arg - this argument contains the changed object.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      The main entry point for all JavaFX applications.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage for the application, onto which the application scene can be set.

    • createText

      private void createText(javafx.scene.Group group)
      This private method creates text objects on two separate corners of the screen. These texts will be used to notify the current player if they won the game or lost.
      Parameters:
      group - An object that represents the root of the gui structure that will be the parents of the text.

    • setUpGrid

      private void setUpGrid(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, int gridNum)
      This is a private method that sets up an individual grid onto the GUI by adding rectangle object onto a grid pane.
      Parameters:
      grid - A grid pane that will hold the rectangle objects.
      gridNum - A number that determines which grid was passed as a parameter.

    • showShipPlacement

      private void showShipPlacement(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent m)
      This private method is an event handler that determines where the user would could place their ship.
      Parameters:
      m - An object that represents a mouse event that resulted from the user moving their mouse on the displayed GUI.

    • restartGrid

      private void restartGrid()
      This private method is called by the mouseMoved event method that redraws the entire grid after the user moved the ship to another spot on the grid. Ignores grids that already have a ship placed.

    • placeShip

      private void placeShip(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent m)
      This is private help method is an event handler that determines what happens when the user places a ship.
      Parameters:
      m - An object that represents a mouse event that resulted from the user clicking on the left mouse button.

    • makeMove

      private void makeMove(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent m)
      This private method is an event handler that determines what will happen when the user selects a position on the opposing player's grid. Sends the results to the either player.
      Parameters:
      m - An object that represents a mouse event that resulted from the user clicking on the left mouse button.

    • changeShipDirection

      private void changeShipDirection(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent key)
      This private helper method is an event handler that determines what happens when the user presses the 'r' key. When the user presses the 'r' key, the direction the ship that will be placed will be changed.
      Parameters:
      key - A object that represents an key event that resulted from user input from their keyboard.

    • updatePlayerGrid

      private void updatePlayerGrid(POSITION_RESULT[][] playerGrid)
      This private helper method updates the current player's grid based on any changes made in the model.
      Parameters:
      playerGrid - A grid of constant that describe the result of a specific position in the player's grid.

    • updateOpponentGrid

      private void updateOpponentGrid(POSITION_RESULT[][] opponentGrid)
      This private helper method updates the opponent's grid based on what the current player did.
      Parameters:
      opponentGrid - A grid of constant that describe the result of a specific position in the opposing player's grid.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String content)
      This method creates an alert based on what the header states and shows it to the user.
      Parameters:
      content - a string representing that the content text would look like in the alert.
